message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the appearance of the sky under clear weather conditions. On a morning when the weather is clear, the sky appears bright because it is filled with sunlight and there are no clouds obstructing the light. Option (B) is incorrect because cloudy weather refers to a sky filled with clouds. Option (C) is incorrect because stormy weather refers to a sky with dark clouds and potential thunderstorms. Option (D) is incorrect because dark skies refer to nighttime or cloudy weather conditions, not clear mornings.

This question requires an understanding of how weather conditions affect the appearance of the sky. When the weather is clear, there are no clouds or storms, and the sky appears bright. Option (B) is incorrect because clouds would obstruct the brightness of the sky. Option (C) is incorrect because stormy weather typically includes rain or thunder, which would also obscure the brightness of the sky. Option (D) is incorrect because darkness usually occurs at night or during cloudy or stormy weather.
